timeline.bodyText:
Why a first if and then a switch ??
Just reading that change, I already know that it will no more work for me.
You must absolutely consider DISCONNECTING too and send a WOL. The state DISCONNECTING is a state that remains a long time in my case. I need the ability to turn on the TV in this case too.
timeline.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: I have to agree with this, you are already sending WOL packets even after it wakes up, so why would it matter sending it while it is disconnecting?
replies.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: the problem is not so much sending the WOL, the problem is, it will be ignored by the TV. It will still shut down, but then our item will be in an incorrect state, until the disconnect finally happens.
replies.author: sprehn

replies.bodyText:
I cxn certify that it is not in my case.
DISCONNECTING is a state while the TV is turned off but the websocket is still alive. So sending the WOL is turning on the TV and you receive at this time a new app value from the subscription and the binding is switching from DISCONNECTING to REGISTERED with a refresh of all subscriptions and a channel state setting to ON.
replies.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText:
the updated version will now send the WOL packet also in DISCONNECTING state.
I will not have any effect if the TV is still shutting down, but it also has no negative effect. And since we are sending multiple packets with a bit of delay there is a chance that it works a few ms later.
replies.author: sprehn

replies.bodyText: it should be resolved
replies.author: sprehn

timeline.bodyText: All your logic was to consider the channel as ON only when REGISTERED. So why setting the channel state to ON when the state is CONNECTING or REGISTERING ?
timeline.author: lolodomo

lolodomo

timeline.bodyText: As already mentioned, I disagree here. We need the ability to turn on the TV with WOL when in this state.

Look at sendCommand, you allow sending commands only when state is REGISTERED.

replies.bodyText:
Your logic since the beginning is that the power channel must be set to ON only when the state is REGISTERED, that means when the binding is ready to handle commands. In all other cases, it must be OFF. I finally agree with your initial logic.
So if you receive a command on this channel when the current state is other than REGISTERED, you must reject the command and you must be sure that the channel state remains OFF.
